page.title: 04NORMAN CHURCH GILLING WEST
page.content: There is evidence that a{monastery} was built in {Gilling} in the {7th } {century}on the site of the present church.This was destroyed by invading {Danes}in the{9th century}yet fragments of{Anglo _ Saxon}stones displayed in the church porch would indicate that {Christian}worship took place in the {9th}and{10th centuries.} The church was rebuilt following the{Norman Conquest}and is mentioned in the{Domesday Book.}In the{14th {century,}the North aisle was built,and about 100 years later the South aisle was added,and the chancel built. The tower was raised in the{15th } {century}and clear storey windows put in to allow more light to enter the church.Internal galleries,to seat land owners workers, were built in{1740.}In {1845}these were demolished and a new chancel and north aisle were built.
